block.p: United Nations diplomats began talks in New York with Haiti's military leader and its exiled President, hoping to restore him to power. Page A3. Tokyo Sends a Message
Japan's leading parties did poorly in Tokyo elections, which were seen as a referendum on the country's national political scandal. Page A3. Rare Latin American Oil Sale
Argentina is taking a step no other Latin American country has tried: selling control of its state oil company to stock-market investors. Page D1. Popular New State Park
In the four weeks since Riverbank State Park opened atop a sewage treatment plant in Harlem, people have been using it in droves. Page B1. Embarrassment of Losses
Mets pitcher Anthony Young's 24th consecutive loss set a major league record. SportsMonday, page C1.
